column4: n}}) was a [[Lord of the Éothéod]].

column1: Léod was a great horseman and during his rule he captured a white foal that was wild and proud. When the horse was grown Léod tried to break him, but instead was thrown off and hit his head on a rock and died (he was but 42 and his son 16). His son [[Eorl]] later tamed the horse, naming him [[Felaróf]], and he would become the first of the great ''[[Mearas]]''.<ref>{{App
'''2002: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'':'''
:A tapestry depicting the death of Léod hangs at [[Meduseld]].
